text:
import numpy
from numba import cuda

@cuda.jit
def kernel(a,b):
    tidx = cuda.threadIdx.x
    bidx = cuda.blockIdx.x
    bdx = cuda.blockDim.x
    pos = tidx + bidx * bdx
    a[pos]*=2;
    b[pos]*=5;



threadsPerBlock = 32 
blocksPerGrid = (400 + (threadsPerBlock - 1)) // threadsPerBlock
a = numpy.arange(400, dtype=numpy.float32)
b = numpy.arange(400, dtype=numpy.float32)

Cuda function pass 'a' and 'b' 
kernel[blocksPerGrid, threadsPerBlock](a,b)
# resulta = a.get()
# resultb = b.get()
print(a,b)

ğŸ”  To achieve 30-50x faster processing from next generation sequencing to variant calling, parabricks  and NVIDIA  team up to offer the NVIDIA Parabricks Genomics Analysis Toolkit.

ğŸ– Parabricks is built using NVIDIA CUDA-X and benefits from CUDA, cuDNN and TensorRT inference software and runs on NVIDIA entire computing platform from NVIDIA T4 to DGX to cloud GPU instances.
